summary: Torvus Reloaded is a fully featured and redesigned batch file builder for TES V: Skyrim. Version 2 will support custom mods, a configuration editor and templates/starter kits for new characters.
descriptionHtml:
[b][size=5]Attention: "Torvus Reloaded" is finished development. I am working on a new version that supports Morrowind, Oblivion, Skyrim (Legendary and Special Editions), Fallout 3, Fallout: New Vegas and Fallout 4. This version is no longer supported, as I am in active development for the new application to replace it called "BethesdaScript" located at [url=https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/88756?]https://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/88756?[/url]

Thank you from everyone who has downloaded and supported the development of Torvus and Torvus Reloaded. I look forward to seeing you guys check out BethesdaScript when I finish it.

Cheers!

[u]Outdated News:[/u]
VERSION 2 HAS RESUMED ACTIVE DEVELOPMENT!
[/size][/b]After a few months of having to move and such, I have resumed active development of Torvus, as well as it's companion applications, Torvus: Fallout, and Torvus: Obvlivion. I am preparing this application for the next Elder Scrolls game when it comes out. 

[list]
[*]Custom mod inclusion
[*]Automatic load order population
[*]starter kits for new characters
[*]configuration viewer
[*]simplified configuration
[*]"Batch Files Galore" integrated - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/34469/]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/34469/[/url]
[/list]
SKYRIM MODDERS! I am adding the following mods to the Torvus Item Lists. I will be expanding the list by the day! If you are a modder who would like one of your mods in Torvus, see below.

[list]
[*]Interesting NPCs - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/8429/]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/8429/[/url]
[*]Immersive Weapons - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/27644/?]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/27644/?[/url]
[*]Immersive Creatures - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/24913/?]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/24913/?[/url]
[*]Immersive Armor - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/19733/?]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/19733/?[/url]
[*]Black Market - [url=http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=432954516&searchtext=]http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=432954516&searchtext=[/url]
[*]Lord of the Rings Weapons - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/5727/?]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/5727/?[/url]
[*]Helgen Reborn - [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/35841/?]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/35841/?[/url]
[/list]

[b][img]https://staticdelivery.nexusmods.com/mods/110/images/54194-0-1461288674.jpg[/img][/b]

[size=4]MOD DEVELOPERS READ HERE[/size]
[size=2]If you're a modder who would like your mod's items in the next Torvus Release, here's what I'll need.

Shoot me an email at screamtherapymedia@gmail.com, with the subject line "Torvus Addon Include: -the name of your mod-". In the email I'll need the following.[/size]

[list]
[*]The URL of your add-on, Steam is alright as well.
[*]The names.TXT file, containing all of the entities for your add-on, attached to the email. (Don't worry about sorting and making it purty, I'll parse it myself, see below.)
[*]I need to know what the actual plugin filename is, so that Torvus can search for it at runtime to check if it exists.
[*]Anything else I need to know about it.
[/list]
[size=3]WHAT WILL HAPPEN TO THE INFO YOU GIVE ME?[/size]
[list]
[*]The download link will be included in the program itself and you will be given credit for the addon (obviously).
[*]I will use a program I wrote called TRICPPT (TrickPuppet, or the Torvus Reloaded Integrated Custom Plugin Processing Tool) that will rip your names.TXT file to s**t and parse it to a configuration that Torvus can use. 
[*]It will be added to a special custom folder within Torvus' main data folder. 
[/list]
[size=3]HOW DO I PREPARE THE NAMES.TXT FILE?[/size]
[list]
[*]Open Creation Kit.
[*]Load your plugin, and any other needed plugins. (TRICPPT will strip away the stock Skyrim Data, so now worries.)
[*]Go to File > Export > Names.
[*]Save the file it spits out, I usually name all of mine 'names.TXT'. Provided it's obvious what it is, I don't need any standard name. 
[*]Send me that file. 
[/list]
Any questions, shoot me an email, or post on this page. 

Cheers,
Bane

[size=4]ABOUT TORVUS RELOADED BATCH FILE BUILDER FOR TES V: SKYRIM[/size][size=4]
[/size][size=2]
Torvus is THE batch file builder for Skyrim. Supporting targeted scripts and a whole bunch else, you'll spit out a batch file capable of putting any mod to the test. As of 4/21/16, Torvus has been renamed Torvus Reloaded, as it is far better and far better designed than its predecessor. Along with the newly designed interface, TR contains support for better targeted scripts as well as more commands. IncPcs command is selectable in the menu and just general fixes. Also included is a logging subroutine that records just about everything the program does in case of a bug. There is an option to view the log in the Help menu.

[/size]PLEASE DL AND ENDORSE! :) Thanx!

[size=4][b]ABOUT TORVUS CONSOLE INCPCS UTILITY
[/b][/size]So, I',m debating on tinkering with a console (command line) version of Torvus. I dunno. But, I did do this one. Although useless, it did make me think that it might be a neat idea. click spoiler to find out how much of a waste of time it was. lol
[spoiler]
UPDATE: I didn't realize this but Skyrim caps IncPcs skill commands out at 100. Which makes the rest of the commands after the 100th time, useless and irrelevant.

So, I used the batch file generated with 1.8 million lines. Nothing happened aside from freezing for 3 minutes.

Anticlimactic. Meh, whatever. It only took about an hour to code.

I was expecting at least some graphical anomalies or something. Nothing. Skyrim is quite the sturdy program I guess... I think I'm gonna try the one with 18 million lines and get a cup of coffee...

Stress testing Skyrim... Yeah, I'm bored today.

So the console application is literally useless... Meh... Was still fun to make. 

So, the more astute of you will notice I uploaded another file to the page, not quite labeled like the others.

[i]Rumor control, here are the facts...
[/i]
So I got really bored and created a stupid little utility that will populate a batch file with IncPcs commands for all skills, [b]at once.[/b]..

Having said that, The text file that this program spits out will be as long as you want it to. This program can handle putting it together, but your text editor ('notepad' by default) is going to have a devil of a time opening it. Mine pooped out by the 100k skill level mark.

Skill level 100's file will be about 79KB and about 1,800 lines.
Skill level 1000's file will be about 793 KB and about 18,000 lines.
Skill level 10k's file will be about 7.9 MB and about 180,000 lines.
Skill level 100k's file will be about 79 MB and about 1.8 million lines.
Skill level 1M's file will be about 793 MB and a whopping 18 million lines of code...

I haven't gone bigger than that, honestly. I don't know about you, but I'm kind of excited to see what Skyrim does with a 79 MB batch file with almost 2 million lines... It will probably crash... 

Most likely it will crash, but in the meantime... WHEEEEE!!!!!
[/spoiler]Update Entries, click Spoiler...
[spoiler]
[b]UPDATE:[/b] As of 4/10/16, I am resuming active development for Torvus. My apologies for the lapse in development, anyone who is married with a child will know the constant struggle for free time and the demands of a full time career. *ugh* The next release, I hope to have out in a few weeks and will include;
[b]*[/b] fixes for the skills (a few of them were mis-nammed)
[b]*[/b] Incremental skill level ups
[b]* [/b]Support for custom plugins[b]
*[/b] nicer interface[b]
*[/b] quest grouping [b]
[/spoiler]
In order to accomplish the new release, Torvus is going to be completely redesigned from the ground up, and I have a few more surprises in addition to what I've already listed here for new features.

[/b]Would be nice to develop this application professionally for Bethesda Softworks to be incorporated into the next Creation Kit... Todd Howard, I'm looking at you, good sir... As always, bug reports and suggestions on the forum below or hit me up at bane@savrasbane.com.

Breath and Focus,
Bane[b]

------------------------------------------------------------------

Can YOU think of a feature that Torvus lacks?[/b] Shoot me an email at bane@savrasbane.com or leave a post on the discussion below. I really want to make this program better.

The current version has a custom list editor, searchable lists as well as other bells and whistles. Any bugs post in the discussion threads or send me an email. bane@savrasbane.com
author: Johnathan Bane for Scream Therapy Media
